item.title: 8 Simulation Games With Horror Elements
item.description:
Simulation games have carved a respectable niche for themselves in the gaming industry. Players love the idea of overseeing every minute detail pertaining to real-life activities that range from a person's daily life to factory operations and everything in between. This may not seem like a compelling gameplay loop, but fans will be surprised to see just how many excellent simulation games make these routine activities so captivating.

This is especially true in the case of simulation games with horror elements that serve as a great way to immerse players in a game world. This is achieved by either scaring the wits out of people or slowly injecting a sense of dread into an experience that makes certain games all the more compelling.

8 Dredge

A Fishing Simulator With A Lovecraftian World That's Quite Sinister

There's a reason why Dredge has become such a massive success. The game's popularity makes it clear that players love the combination of fishing simulator gameplay with Lovecraftian elements. Players control a fisherman who decides to operate in a small hamlet, only to realize something sinister brewing around them.

Dredge 's unnerving atmosphere ensures that players will be on the edge of their seats, even if the moment-to-moment gameplay is nowhere near as challenging as fans wanted. The idea of staying out for too long at night is a disturbing one that most players would prefer to avoid as they play it safe and rake in a decent chunk of money with their consistent fishing efforts.

7 Home Safety Hotline

Players Control A Telephone Operator Who Must Deal With A Variety Of Disturbing Calls

Players who want to know how it feels to be a 911 operator who must answer disturbing calls will love what Home Safety Hotline brings to the table. The game is pretty creepy from the get-go but slowly eases players into the experience with simple cases, only for a horrifying curveball to come out of nowhere.

Hearing the dread in someone's voice as they try to communicate the nature of a threat breaking into their home while trying to be as silent as possible will send chills down a player's spine. Giving callers the response they need to tackle a threat is important and can be pretty challenging, but players shouldn't have too many issues nailing solutions after struggling early on.

6 Five Nights at Freddy's

Step Into The Shoes Of A Security Guard And Keep An Eye Out On Rabid Animatronics

Players who think that the work of a security guard in the night is easy will sing a different tune after Five Nights at Freddy's . Sure, horrifying animatronics may not be a reality, but this game will hammer in just how harrowing it can be for a lone guard to figure out that there's a threat spotted by the cameras.

Players must keep their eyes on the cameras at all times to ensure that none of the creepy animatronics try to chew them up during the night. The simulation gameplay may be a veneer to make the scares more effective, but it got the job done given how massive this multimedia franchise has become courtesy of the first game that was a viral hit.

5 Project Zomboid

The Way Players Develop Skills In This Game Emulates The Feel Of A Life Sim

Players who feel like Project Zomboid is nothing special based on its run-of-the-mill visuals will be singing a different tune after experiencing this title's gameplay loop for themselves. Surviving in a zombie apocalypse was never going to be easy, but Project Zomboid is jam-packed with so many mechanics that a few deaths are required for players to understand what this title is all about.

Soon enough, most people will learn to prioritize certain skills early on as they help their chosen survivor educate themselves by any means necessary. Supply runs can be nerve-wracking every single time, but players will find this task to be easier once they improve the survivability skills of their character.

4 Graveyard Keeper

The Horror Aesthetic Isn't Meant To Be Too Scary And Lends A Unique Atmosphere To This Cemetery Management Game

Not everything in the horror medium needs to make people feel a sense of unease. Sometimes, horror games are all about the vibes, with Graveyard Keeper being a great example of the same. Managing a cemetery may not seem relaxing, but players will be singing a different tune after investing a few meaningful hours in this title.

Restoring an overgrown cemetery and tending to its graves is more relaxing than players would assume. It takes a while to grow on players, but the cozy horror vibes of Graveyard Keeper make it a great simulation game players can check out.

3 Green Hell

Encountering A Predator Or Hearing Voices In A Hostile Jungle Is Quite Unnerving

Players who have dreams about living in the Amazon rainforest won't be looking forward to this activity anytime soon after playing Green Hell . This open-world survival simulation title pulls no punches as players must battle predators and diseases at the same time.

There's nothing more harrowing than struggling to survive for hours only to come face-to-face with a panther or hear the chanting of cultists. The hallucinations that occur when the player's mental state is fragile don't help, adding to the creepy factor of this game.

2 Mirthwood

A Dark Medieval Fantasy Game Where Players Simulate The Life Of A Character Who Can Be Anything They Want

An underrated video game that more people will love checking out after it fixes some of its issues, Mirthwood is a charming life simulator in medieval times where players can be everything from a farm owner to a traveling adventurer. It helps that the world is dark and foreboding enough to keep players interested.

Exploration can lead to some creepy findings that players may find daunting to check out. Once the bugs in Mirthwood are patched out, players can enjoy an amazing survival title that boasts a ton of replayability and promise.

1 Cultist Simulator

A Card-Based Management Simulation Where Players Pursue Knowledge From Dark, Eldritch Beings

  • Platforms: PC, Mobile, Nintendo Switch
  • Release Date: May 31, 2018
  • Developer: Weather Factory

The idea of using cards to dictate a person's life may not seem all that engaging, but the immaculate vibes of Cultist Simulator ensure that simulating the life of a citizen in a Lovecraftian setting feels amazing.

Players must join cults and attain revelations while avoiding the ire of the authorities. Progression is gated by everything from obtuse rituals to human sacrifices, which makes for a unique gameplay loop that makes this title one of the best simulation games with horror elements players can check out.

item.title: Stardew Valley: Where To Find Every Forage Item
item.description:
Stardew Valley is all about appreciating nature and living off the land, so it comes as no surprise that foraging is one of the game's central mechanics. In every season, the valley offers a different selection of mushrooms, fruits, and other items that the player can gather for use in recipes or crafting artisan goods.

Some of these items, though, can be a bit tricky to track down, especially in large quantities. The tables below provide a guide to all the game's forage items by season, and in which areas they can be found. Locations are listed by the likelihood of finding the specific item there, from the highest chance to the lowest chance of that item spawning.

Updated December 20, 2024, by Demaris Oxman: The 1.6 update for Stardew Valley is finally available on all platforms, after months of only being accessible on PC. Now, all farmers can explore everything this new version of the game has to offer. For players who love foraging, there are a few changes to be aware of as they head out to explore. Many forage items are now more versatile, as players can make them into Juice or Pickles with Kegs or Preserves Jars, respectively. New items like the Mushroom Log and events like the Green Rain offer new methods for players to stock up on certain items. With that in mind, this guide has been updated to keep players on top of all the knowledge they need to gather and use mushrooms, flowers, berries, and more.

Year-Round

Several locations throughout Stardew Valley contain items that can be foraged year-round, either due to their environment (e.g., the Beach), or a static climate (e.g., Calico Desert). Such items and their locations are listed below:

Item

Locations

Uses

Cactus Fruit

Calico Desert

  • Can be placed in Kegs, Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • Used to craft warp totem/obelisk for Calico Desert
  • Bundles: Exotic Foraging, Dyes (remixed)

Coconut

Calico Desert, or shaken from trees on Ginger Island

  • Can be placed in Kegs, Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • Used to craft warp totem/obelisk for Calico Desert
  • Exotic Foraging Bundle

Ginger

Ginger Island; look for small green fronds in the sand and dig them up with the hoe.

  • Cooking
  • Can be placed in Kegs and Preserves Jars
  • May be requested for a Special Order

Fiddlehead Fern

Ginger Island jungle

  • Cooking
  • Can be placed in Kegs and Preserves Jars

Magma Cap

The Volcano Dungeon on Ginger Island

  • Excellent source of health and energy
  • Can be placed in Preserves Jars and Dehydrator

Cave Carrot

The Mines, usually found by digging ground with the hoe or blowing it up with a bomb

Can be placed in Kegs and Preserves Jars

Moss

Grows on trees in all seasons except Winter, and can be collected with any tool, weapon, or bomb. Moss becomes much more plentiful during the Green Rain event in Summer, which also spawns weeds that can drop Moss.

Many crafting uses

  • Common Mushroom
  • Morel
  • Chanterelle

Can grow in the Mushroom Cave or on the Mushroom Log

  • Can be placed in Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • Various Community Center bundles

  • Red Mushroom
  • Purple Mushroom

  • The Mines, floors 80+
  • Can grow in the Mushroom Cave or on the Mushroom Log
  • Tapping a Mushroom Tree

  • Purple Mushroom: Can be placed in Preserves Jars and Dehydrator
  • Both are options for various Community Center bundles

  • Clam
  • Cockle
  • Mussel
  • Oyster
  • Seaweed

All have an equal chance to be found on the Beach

  • Cooking, some crafting recipes
  • Crab Pot Bundle (except Seaweed)

  • Coral
  • Sea Urchin

The right side of the Beach, past the broken bridge

Crafting recipes

Spring

Springtime foraging is particularly important in Year 1, as many players rely on it for income during the first few in-game weeks. Even in later years, though, these items can help boost profits and allow the player to cook certain recipes.

Item

Locations

Uses

Daffodil

Pelican Town, Railroad, Bus Stop

Spring Foraging Bundle

Dandelion

Cindersap Forest, Bus Stop, Railroad, Forest Farm

Spring Foraging Bundle

Leek

Backwoods (north of the farm, west of the Mountain), Mountain, Forest Farm, Bus Stop, Railroad

  • Cooking
  • Spring Foraging Bundle

Wild Horseradish

Secret Woods, Cindersap Forest, Backwoods, Mountain, Forest Farm

Spring Foraging Bundle

Common Mushroom

Secret Woods

Can be placed in Preserves Jars and Dehydrator

Morel

Secret Woods, Forest Farm

Can be placed in Preserves Jars and Dehydrator

Salmonberry

Can be shaken from bushes, Spring 15-18 only. The number of berries received corresponds to the player's Foraging skill.

  • Can be placed in Kegs, Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • Children's Bundle (remixed)

Spring Onion

Cindersap Forest, in the patches of tillable ground in the southeast portion of the area.

  • Can be placed in Kegs and Preserves Jars
  • Spring Foraging Bundle (remixed)

Summer

Summer typically has a heavier focus on farming than foraging, but these items are still worth picking up. If the player has a Seed Maker, they can even use their foraged Grapes to get plenty of free Grape Starter to plant in the fall.

Item

Locations

Uses

Sweet Pea

Pelican Town, Cindersap Forest, Bus Stop, Railroad, Forest Farm

Summer Foraging bundle

Spice Berry

Cindersap Forest, Backwoods, Mountain, Bus Stop, Railroad, Forest Farm

  • Can be placed in Kegs, Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • ​​​​​​​Summer Foraging Bundle

Grape

Backwoods, Mountain, Bus Stop, Railroad, Forest Farm

  • Can be placed in Kegs, Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • ​​​​​​​Summer Foraging bundle

Red Mushroom

Secret Woods

  • Various bundles
  • Life Elixir crafting recipe

Fiddlehead Fern

  • Secret Woods
  • Chopping down a Green Rain Tree type 3 (the one that looks like a giant, curled fiddlhead) yields up to 6. Placing a Tapper on one of these trees will also yield Fiddlehead Ferns.

Can be placed in Kegs and Preserves Jars

Common Mushroom

Forest Farm

Can be placed in Preserves Jars and Dehydrator

Rainbow Shell

The Beach

Fall

Fall is one of the best seasons for foraging, as all of these items are plentiful in their respective locations. Furthermore, almost all can be used in handy cooking recipes, including Blackberry Cobbler, Plum Pudding, Roasted Hazelnuts, and more.

Item

Location

Uses

Common Mushroom

Cindersap Forest, Secret Woods, Forest Farm, Mountain, Backwoods

  • Can be placed in Preserves Jars and Dehydrator
  • Fall Forage Bundle

Wild Plum

Bus Stop, Railroad, Backwoods, Mountain

  • Can be placed in Kegs, Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • Fall Forage Bundle

Blackberry

  • Pelican Town, Cindersap Forest, Railroad
  • Can be shaken from bushes between Fall 8-11 only; the number of berries received from this method corresponds to the player's Foraging skill.

  • Can be placed in Kegs, Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • Fall Forage Bundle

Hazelnut

  • Backwoods, Mountain, Bus Stop, Railroad
  • On or after Fall 14, shaking Maple Trees provides a small chance of receiving one.

  • Cooking
  • Fall Forage bundle
  • Can be placed in Kegs and Preserves Jars

Chanterelle

Secret Woods, Forest Farm

Can be placed in Preserves Jars and Dehydrator

Red Mushroom

Forest Farm, Secret Woods

  • Various bundles
  • Life Elixir crafting recipe

Purple Mushroom

Forest Farm

  • Excellent source of health and energy
  • Can be placed in Preserves Jars and Dehydrator
  • Various bundles
  • Life Elixir crafting recipe

Winter

Winter can be a tough time for earning money, especially in the early game. Foraging, though, can prove quite lucrative during this time. What's more, players can use their forage to craft Wild Seeds, and use each successive harvest to craft more and more seeds before shipping the products at the end of the season.

Item

Location

Uses

Crystal Fruit

Railroad, Cindersap Forest, Mountain, Bus Stop, Backwoods, Pelican Town

  • Can be placed in Kegs, Preserves Jars, and Dehydrator
  • Winter Forage bundle

Crocus

Pelican Town, Railroad, Bus Stop, Mountain, Cindersap Forest, Backwoods

Winter Forage bundle

Winter Root

Tilling soil throughout the areas in Stardew Valley, with a higher chance to be found in Artifact Spots.

  • Can be placed in Kegs and Preserves Jars
  • Winter Forage bundle

Snow Yam

Tilling soil throughout the areas in Stardew Valley, with a higher chance to be found in Artifact Spots.

  • Can be placed in Kegs and Preserves Jars
  • Winter Forage bundle

Holly

Secret Woods, Backwoods, Pelican Town, Bus Stop, Cindersap Forest, Mountain

Various remixed bundles

Nautilus Shell

The Beach

Field Research bundle

item.title: Marvel Rivals: How to Create Custom Games
item.description:
Marvel Rivals is the newest entry in the PvP Hero Shooter genre, and it's already jam-packed with plenty of features for players to explore. From a fleshed-out battle pass system to an in-game Store chock-full of cool cosmetics for your favorite childhood hero, the game pulls out all the stops to keep things interesting.

Marvel Rivals also has multiple game modes, including a competitive mode where you can put your skills to the test. However, sometimes you just want to lay back and enjoy the game in a low-pressure environment. That's where the custom game system comes in. In this guide, we'll show how to create a custom game in Marvel Rivals where you can play with your friends, bots, or a combination of both.

How to Create a Custom Game in Marvel Rivals

To create a custom game in Marvel Rivals , follow these steps:

  • Launch the game.
  • Click the Play button in the top left corner of the main menu.
  • Click on Change Mode above the Start button.
  • In the Rivalry tab, choose Custom Game.

This will bring up a list of available lobbies that are currently active. You can join or spectate different lobbies if they are set to open. To create a custom game of your own, click the Create button under the list of lobbies. This will take you to a new section where you can invite your friends, add bots, or adjust different lobby options.

Inviting Friends to Custom Game in Marvel Rivals

After you've created a custom game, you'll have the option to invite your friends to join the two teams. To invite your friends, click on one of the empty boxes with the plus sign. This will open your friend list, and you can choose who you want to invite to your lobby.

To Shuffle players in the lobby, click the Random Shuffle button.

If you want to play against bots, click the Add Bots button below the empty boxes. This will open up the Add Bots menu, where you can choose how many bots to add and the difficulty level of the AI.

To remove a player or bot from the teams, right-click on the player's slot and choose Remove.

Adjusting Custom Game Settings in Marvel Rivals

Marvel Rivals gives players plenty of options to fine-tune their experience in Custom Games. Here's a quick list of settings you can adjust in your custom lobby.

  • To change the server, click on the currently active server located above the Spectators box. This will bring up a list of servers along with your latency in each region. Choose the best server for all the players in the lobby and click Confirm.
  • You can set a password for your custom lobby by locking the room. To do that, head to the Room Settings menu and tick the Lock Room box near the Game Name. Enter the password in the text box and hit Confirm.
  • The Join Access option in Room Settings lets you decide who can join the lobby. By default, it's set to Open to All, allowing anyone to hop in. You can set it to Friends Only or Invitation Only.
  • The next option you can adjust is Spectator Access. Setting it to Open to All allows anyone to spectate the game, while Friends Only restricts access to only those in your friend list. If you don't want spectators, set this option to No Spectating.
  • If you're playing on a Competitive Map, you can also set a Ban/Pick system in the game. Your options are Team Ban, Leader Ban, or No Ban/Pick.
  • To choose the Map and Game Mode, you'll have to click on the currently active map above the Start button from the custom game room. Each map in Marvel Rivals is tied to a specific game mode. Choose the map you want to play on and click Confirm to set it as the active map.

To select multiple maps, tick the Multi-Select Box in the Map menu and choose the maps you want to set as active.

Custom Games in Marvel Rivals can be an excellent tool, whether you want to warm up before jumping into real games or play some quick, relaxing games with those on your friends list. You can also use this game mode to test different hero combos with your friends or fine-tune your PC settings without worrying about losing the game.

item.title: 10 Best Planes For Customization In GTA Online
item.description:
Summary

  • In GTA Online , planes are valuable assets for fast travel and combat, including customization options.
  • The Smuggler's Run DLC added 14 new aircraft, each with unique features like bomb bays and machine guns.
  • Planes like the Western Seabreeze, Buckingham Pyro, and V-65 Molotok offer diverse performance and weapon customization options.

In GTA Online , planes are one of the fastest ways to get around San Andreas. Even with vehicles seemingly getting faster and faster with each passing update, planes, helicopters and all aircraft alike have proven to be some of the most valuable assets to any GTA Online character's career, even if they can be a hassle to get to the predetermined spawning location on the map.

With the Smuggler's Run DLC, Rockstar Games added a stunning 14 new aircraft to the somewhat lacking fleet in the game, giving players a new place to store aircraft in the Hanger business in the process. On top of that, players can purchase a Hanger Workshop upgrade when buying a Hanger, allowing the modification and customization of their shiny, new plane .

10 Western Seabreeze

A Boat And Plane In One

  • Price : $1,130,500

The Western Seabreeze is an odd-looking plane. Its propellor sits on a housing on top of the tail, the door to the cockpit is accessed by the cockpit window opening up like a hatch, and it is a seaplane. While not exactly a new thing to the Grand Theft Auto universe, seaplanes are usually slower-moving crafts with big, bulky floats or pontoons keeping the fuselage away from the water.

The Seabreeze bucks that trend by being a zippy little plane, especially with performance and handling upgrades. It can be outfitted with a bomb bay, letting players drop different kinds of bombs like incendiary, gas, or cluster bombs. It can also house dual machine guns on the wings, letting players shoot back at pursuers, as well as flare or chaff countermeasures.

9 Buckingham Pyro

Twin-Tailed And Turbocharged

  • Price : $4,455,500

With its twin-boom tails, the Buckingham Pyro is a unique plane with a lot under the hood. Contrary to its design, the Pyro is a maneuverable and tight-turning airplane at stock, making it a great choice for dogfighting. While the machine guns are somewhat lackluster, the Pyro can also be outfitted with homing missiles mounted under the wings, and a standard set of countermeasures.

Besides the livery and painting options, the Pyro with performance upgrades becomes the second-fastest plane in GTA Online , now only outperformed by the ​​​​​​​popular F-160 Raiju fighter jet. However, beyond that, there is not much in the realm of customization for the Pyro left over.

8 V-65 Molotok

Slow And Steady

  • Price : $4,788,000

The V-65 Molotok is Rockstar Games' take on an older Russian fighter jet. It features a strange air intake for the nose and a sleek profile in the air, all while jetting around at average speeds.

The Molotok comes standard with twin machine guns on the nose, with the option of adding dual pods of homing missiles. The Molotok can also be fitted with drop tanks on the wings, though they provide no benefit and are only cosmetic. It also features a number of military liveries and countermeasures.

7 LF-22 Starling

It's Not A Bird, It's A Plane

  • Price : $3,657,500

Since the LF-22 Starling is named after a little bird, it makes sense that it's a nimble and aerodynamic jet. Its small and compact body provides the Starling with very average performance overall. However, there is one upgrade that turns this teeny tiny plane into ​​​​​​​a bird of prey.

The Starling can be outfitted with a Rocket Boost Upgrade, giving it super-speed on tap to help with dive-bombing tactics. The Starling can also carry the standard homing missiles as well as a bomb bay for increased firepower.

6 Nagasaki Ultralight

Cruising Around At The Speed Of Wind

  • Price : $665,000

The Nagasaki Ultralight is an intriguing aircraft. While not classified as a full-blown plane and more of a glider, the Ultralight is a lot more nimble than other options. On top of the performance upgrades and various livery choices for the glider, the Ultralight can be kitted out with a couple of different propellors. While both the stock and extended propellors are only cosmetic changes, the Muffled Carbon Propellor provides players with reduced radar detection on take-off and while gliding in the air.

The Ultralight can also be an easy target for enemy aircraft. It can be outfitted with the player's choice of flares, which helps avoid homing missiles, or chaff, which prevents lock-on capable weapons for a short time. Players can also purchase a gimbal turret for their Ultralight, providing the glider with some armament, though the guns are weak against ​​​​​​​armored vehicles.

5 Western Company Rogue

Guns, Missiles, And More Guns

  • Price : $1,596,000

The Western Company Rogue has a number of customization options available. While the livery and painting options, along with the standard performance upgrades, come as expected, the Rogue has a number of weapon upgrades available too.

The Rogue comes with no weapons at stock, so players will have to pay extra for their choice of either ​​​​​​​machine guns or explosive cannons. The machine guns are the standard guns found on most planes, while the explosive cannons available for the Rogue are found on the P-996 LAZER fighter jet, the Hydra jet, and the F-160 Raiju. Players can also add homing missiles as secondary weapons if they choose.

4 Mammoth Mogul

Bring A Flight Crew

  • Price : $3,125,500

Based on a World War Two-era strike aircraft, the Mammoth Mogul is not the prettiest sight in the sky. It flies at an average pace on par with some of the medium-sized aircraft in its class, but it shines in its available modifications.

The Mogul comes outfitted with a bubble turret with a single .50 caliber machine gun for a gunner, and another gun on the nose for the pilot. Players can opt for dual guns for both the turret and nose gun to increase the Mogul's firepower, and a bomb bay. The Mogul can also support Jet-Assisted Take-Off, or JATO, which propels the Mogul forward at lightning speed for a quick take-off. On top of all of that, the livery choices and countermeasures make the Mogul a great plane to fly with a crew.

3 Mammoth Tula

Seaplane With A Party Trick

  • Price : $4,100,000

The Mammoth Tula is one of the few planes in GTA Online capable of Vertical Take-Off and Landing, or VTOL. Adding to its VTOL ability, it is also a seaplane, allowing it to land on virtually any surface, making the Tula excellent for utility.

Aside from its ​​​​​​​amphibious features, the Tula can be fitted with JATO thrusters for quick take-offs on both land and water, and the gunner's seat in the back can be upgraded to either dual .50 caliber guns or even a minigun for a bullet-spitting machine. The Tula can also carry a bomb bay and either flare or chaff countermeasures.

2 RM-10 Bombushka

Enemy Gunship In The Air

  • Price : $4,750,000

With a massive wingspan, and a body that could make the Titan blush, the RM-10 Bombushka is one hulking mass of firepower. Inside its roomy fuselage, players can control remote turrets that sit on the Bombushka's nose, rear, and on top of the plane.

Those turrets come as dual .50 caliber guns, but both the nose guns and the rear guns can be upgraded to 30mm explosive cannons, similar to the cannon on the Valkyrie helicopter. The Bombushka can also be fitted with a JATO system, allowing the beast to get to altitude quickly. There is also a bomb bay upgrade available to players.

1 Mammoth Avenger

Mother Of All VTOL

  • Price : $3,450,000 - $6,237,500

The Mammoth Avenger is the most utility players can find in an airplane. It is purchased via the Warstock Cache and Carry website and can be stored in either a player's ​​​​​​​Doomsday Heist Facility or a Hanger. It has a full-on interior which can be customized, and even three gun turrets.

Not only that, but it can house both a Mark Two Weapons Workshop and a Vehicle Workshop for the player's weaponized vehicles. Only adding to the utility, in the Hanger workshop there are unique upgrades available, such as the Avenger's own Thruster jetpack, a Stealth Module, and a Missile Lock-On Jammer. Finally, the Avenger can be held in the air with an autopilot mode. The Avenger truly is a one-of-a-kind aircraft with all the utility in the world and then some.

item.title: Viral In-Game Minecraft Emulator Now Has Redstone
item.description:
Summary

  • A Minecraft player added redstone to their in-game emulator, showing creativity and innovation within the community.
  • Redditor ModPunchtree shared the coding process for working redstone items like dust, torches, repeaters, and lamps.
  • Inventive uses of redstone demonstrate potential for building complex contraptions in Minecraft.

An inventive Minecraft player has added redstone to the emulator they created for Mojang's sandbox that runs inside the game. Redstone is one of the oldest Minecraft items, dating back to the earliest versions of the game. It is also one of the favorite resources of players who like to exercise their creativity in a more elaborate way by creating contraptions of various kinds, from functional to more intricate projects.

The community has already shared countless examples of these ideas, such as the Minecraft player who build a playable version of Minesweeper using redstone, achieving a result that was very faithful to the classic Windows game. Other players have recreated iconic games such as Geometry Dash , and Guitar Hero , and made useful builds such as activatable portals, smart elevators, and efficient ways to grow items such as bamboo. This time, a player has shared an even more special project, proving that the uses for redstone are many.

Redditor ModPunchtree added redstone to their Minecraft emulator that runs inside the game. They shared the coding process in a video, showing how they added the well-known Minecraft item to the version of the game that runs on IRIS, the popular redstone computer they made. In the comments section, they explain that the update introduced working versions of redstone dust, torches, repeaters, and lamps. They go on to say that this was one of the most requested additions by players after they gave color to the graphics of their Minecraft emulator.

Player Impresses by Adding Functional Redstone to Minecraft Emulator that Runs In-Game

ModPunchtree is a member of the Minecraft community known for their experiments with redstone, who keeps a YouTube channel where they share their projects with the audience. In addition to this impressive addition of redstone to their emulator, the OP has made headlines other times by creating playable versions of DOOM and Tetris . Another project of theirs that also impressed was the use of ray tracing, the popular technology that improves the visual experience for games, which was given a working version on their computer through redstone.

Examples like this show off the inventiveness of Minecraft players, which makes it famous for its endless creativity. Redstone, in particular, stands out for being one of the most complex items in the game and is perfect for tech-savvy players to bring their ideas to life. Going further, these mechanics have great untapped potential for Mojang, which could bring to life a Minecraft spinoff inspired by Satisfactory , allowing players to create even more complex contraptions.
